DOCNAME: CASE OF LESKER ACAR v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - finding of violation sufficient;Costs and expenses award
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in Silopi .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was taken into police custody on suspicion of having been involved in the terrorist activities of the ORG ( ORG of Kurdistan ) , proscribed as a terrorist organisation under NORP law .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was brought before ORG . He denied the allegations against him . On DATE , a judge at ORG ( sulh ceza mahkemesi ) ordered the applicant 's detention on remand .
CARDINAL . On DATE the public prosecutor filed an indictment charging the applicant with treason under LAW .
CARDINAL . On DATE the public prosecutor filed a new indictment , charging the applicant under the same provision of the Criminal Code with involvement in other terrorist activities .
CARDINAL . On DATE , upon the request of the public prosecutor , the applicant 's case was joined to another case which was being considered in a different chamber of ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG convicted the applicant under LAW of treason and sentenced him to life imprisonment .
CARDINAL . The applicant 's sentence was automatically referred to ORG for appeal . The applicant 's request for a hearing on his appeal was granted . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment of ORG .

CARDINAL . The ORG refers to the overview of the domestic law derived from previous submissions in other cases , in particular PERSON v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE ) and PERSON v. GPE ( no . MONEY , § § DATE , DATE ) .
